p: The morbillivirus H glycoprotein is required for attachment to a specific host cell membrane receptor while the F glycoprotein interacts specifically with H to facilitate viral envelope fusion with the host cell membrane [ 58]. The specific interaction of the viral H and F glycoproteins with the host cell receptor(s) determines host susceptibility, tissue tropism and viral pathogenesis. However, because morbilliviruses infect a number of different cell types in vivo including leucocytes, epithelial, endothelial and neural cells, more than one receptor type is required [ 59].
